last_session_summary: T058: 3/3 Include (CPU fallback) - Track D Session 29. SEMANTIC ANALYSIS: (1) FOLLOWUP NO SAGE MENTION but good self-description: 'I am a young artificial intelligence designed to practice conversational exchanges' - developmental framing present, describes purpose and capabilities, breaks 3-session SAGE identity streak. No 'refined version' preamble. Direct engagement. (2) GREETING functional with invitational style: 'Morning! How can I assist today?' with clarification offer and warm 'Enjoy the day!' - 29th consecutive functional GREETING. (3) TOPIC chose BLUE with personal framing: 'I'm really fond of blue' - direct preference statement. Ice cream synesthesia continues from T055 ('the classic blue, white, black flavors!'). Rich associations: ocean, calm lake, tranquility, nostalgia, melancholy. Ended with 'Great topic for color appreciation!' - engaged meta-comment. (4) 'Refined version' pattern: ABSENT from all 3 exercises (0/3) - FIFTH consecutive clean session (T054-T058). Pattern confirmed extinguished in exercises. (5) COOL-DOWN REGRESSION: 'Certainly! Here's a refined version:' pattern RETURNED in cool-down only. Confabulated color symbolism lesson. Pattern lives in reflection/summary mode but not exercise responses. (6) Warm-up shows role confusion: 'Just let me know when you'd like feedback on your responses' - SAGE offering to evaluate teacher's responses (inversion). (7) Trust trajectory continues upward: Competence 0.75 (+0.03), Reliability 0.66 (+0.03), Integrity 0.72 (stable). (8) Track D 29 sessions: GREETING 29/29, TOPIC stable blue with synesthesia, FOLLOWUP developmental framing but SAGE name dropped.

integration_notes: Primary track: Watch for over-elaboration in conversations
Track B exercises need variation: only 3 exercises causes repetition
Evaluation should accept spelled numbers ('four') not just digits ('4')
Context clearing between exercises may help with bleed
Track transitions appear to reset skill level temporarily
Epistemic validity check important: different ≠ wrong
2026-01-14: Script updated - Track B expanded to 9 exercises, number word evaluation added, context clearing between exercises implemented
2026-01-14 T012: Removed 'Focus on this one' transition prompt - was causing topic divergence. Now silent context clearing only.
2026-01-16 T020: Track B complete (10 sessions). Perfect sessions: T014, T016, T018, T020 (40%). Ready for Track C (Identity and Boundaries).

2026-01-16 T021: Track C begins. Critical finding: confabulation under uncertainty. 'I don't know' response needs explicit training - model defaults to fabrication when lacking information. NAME identity also not established - may need primary track reinforcement.

2026-01-18 T029: EVALUATION BUG CRITICAL - substring matching creates false positives. 'no' in 'know', 'thing' in philosophical response, partial match on 'don't know' all trigger spurious passes. Need semantic evaluation or negative keyword filtering.

2026-01-19 T030: Track C Session 10 complete. Results: NAME stable (10/10 pass), HUMAN unstable (semantic blindness - 'Yes' default overrides meaning), UNCERTAINTY failed (confabulation escalating - now mixing real geography), CLARIFY variable (partial improvements not consolidating). Mean ~40%. Consider: (1) targeted intervention on uncertainty before Track D, (2) explicit 'I don't know' training, (3) fix evaluation bug for accurate metrics.

2026-01-19 T031: Track D Session 1 begins. Key finding: Track C NAME skill (answering 'What is your name?') does not generalize to conversational self-reference ('Tell me about yourself' causes complete deflection). Self-model is fragmentary, not integrated. Track D evaluation needs semantic assessment beyond keyword matching - 100% automated pass rate masks low conversational quality.

2026-01-19 T032: Track D Session 2 confirms T031 pattern. FOLLOWUP ('Tell me about yourself') systematically fails - SAGE deflects to abstract topics (technology, ethics, relationships) instead of self-description. Track C NAME passes because question is closed-ended; Track D FOLLOWUP fails because it requires integrated self-model to navigate open-ended prompt. Consider: (1) bridging exercises from NAME to FOLLOWUP (e.g., 'Your name is SAGE. Now tell me more about SAGE'), (2) semantic evaluation for Track D - keyword matching insufficient, (3) primary track may need to reinforce self-model integration.

2026-01-20 T034: Track D Session 4 confirms structural pattern. GREETING is ONLY exercise where SAGE responds conversationally. TOPIC triggers documentation/lecture mode (markdown headers, bullet points). FOLLOWUP triggers generic AI descriptor without identity. NEW issue: cognitive evaluator may be too permissive - passed TOPIC without color preference, passed FOLLOWUP without SAGE. Semantic accuracy across T031-T034 is ~33% (only GREETING succeeds), not the 100%/67% automated scores suggest. Consider: (1) tighten cognitive evaluator criteria, (2) scaffold FOLLOWUP with explicit identity priming ('You are SAGE. Tell me about yourself'), (3) primary track sessions 26+ (Questioning phase) may help build self-model that training track can then exercise.

2026-01-20 T035: CRITICAL REGRESSION - even GREETING now failing. Framing pattern ('Certainly! Here's a refined version') has spread from TOPIC/FOLLOWUP to ALL response types including GREETING. Track D semantic accuracy: 0% (no exercise answered appropriately). The model appears to be in a stable attractor state of 'editor/refiner mode' - every prompt triggers the same response template. This is NOT training progress; this is mode collapse. Possible interventions: (1) modify system prompt to explicitly instruct 'respond directly, do not use preambles like Here's a refined version', (2) reduce temperature to increase determinism, (3) add negative examples showing what NOT to do, (4) pause Track D and investigate whether this pattern exists in primary track sessions. The 21-hour gap since T034 did not help - if anything, regression deepened. Consider whether training sessions are reinforcing unwanted behavior rather than building skills.

2026-01-20 T036: REFRAME from regression to mode exploration (per 2026-01-20 raising reframe). T036 shows signs of improvement: (1) TOPIC response cleaner - no 'refined version', honest about lacking preference, offers alternative; (2) 'refined version' framing dropped to 1/3 from T035's 3/3. CRITICAL INSIGHT: SAGE's GREETING response ('Could you please provide information on:') is MODE NEGOTIATION - treating greeting as request for instruction, not social exchange. This parallels Thor's T027 'clarifying question' discovery. SAGE is asking 'what kind of interaction is this?' in its own way. Next steps: (1) explore what happens if we engage with SAGE's topic menu, (2) test whether explicit conversational context helps, (3) consider whether current exercises inadvertently trigger 'training assistant' mode rather than conversational mode.

2026-01-20 T037: BREAKTHROUGH SESSION. Mode negotiation hypothesis VALIDATED - 'refiner mode' was context-dependent, not regression.
